question.text: Bacteria genetically engineered to express a cDNA from a plant cell will

options.text: synthesize a protein with the same sequence of amino acids as in the plant and, therefore, the  protein will have the same structure and function as in the plant
synthesize a protein with essentially the same sequence of amino acids as in the plant but with         differences relating to different codons between prokaryotes and eukaryotes
not be able to synthesize a protein due to the presence of exon, splicing sequences in the DNA  sequence from the plant
not be able to synthesize a protein because translation is coupled with transcription and post- transcriptional processing does not occur in it.

solution.text: The bacteria which is genetically engineered to express a cDNA from a plant cell will synthesize a protein with the same sequence of amino acids as in the plant. Thus, the protein will have the same structure as it had in the plant. Also, it will perform the same function which it performed in the plant.
